Gravedigger charged with sexually assaulting boy in mosque toilet
Published on: Thursday, July 17, 2025
Published on: Thu, Jul 17, 2025
By: FMT Reporters
Text Size:
Dark Mode: Off
Text:
Dark Mode: Off
Syahril Reza Omar pleaded not guilty after the charge was read in the Taiping sessions court.
PETALING JAYA:
A gravedigger has been charged in the Taiping sessions court with committing physical sexual assault on a nine-year-old boy last year.
Syahril Reza Omar, 43, pleaded not guilty after the charge was read before judge Nabisha Ibrahim, Berita Harian reported.
Advertisement
Syahril was charged with sexually assaulting the victim by kissing his face and neck in the women’s toilet of a mosque in Kamunting at around 12.30pm on July 11.
The charge was framed under Section 14(a) of the Sexual Offences Against Children Act 2017, which provides for a maximum of 20 years in prison and a whipping, upon conviction.
SPONSORED CONTENT
Thailand Week Makes Its Exciting Debut Indoors at The Spring Shopping Mall, Kuching
Featuring over 100 booths it is one of the largest trade and culture showcases ever held in East Malaysia.
Read more
Deputy public prosecutor Shabani Bahari proposed bail of RM30,000 but lawyer Syed Saifullizan Syed Abd Razak from the National Legal Aid Foundation asked for a lower amount, saying his client only received a monthly allowance of RM400 a month as a gravedigger.
He also said that Syahril was a single father with three children aged eight to 19 to care for.
Advertisement
Nabisha allowed bail of RM8,000, ordered Syahril to report to the cops every month, and fixed Aug 19 for case mention.

author: Spencer McKee
title: Driver busted after getting clocked at 126 MPH on Colorado's I-25 | outtherecolorado.com
text: A driver in Colorado was recently busted while allegedly traveling at a notably excessive speed of 126 miles per hour. Regardless of where someone is at in the state, this is obviously far above the posted speed limit. The incident was covered in a [release](https://www.facebook.com/ThorntonPD/) from the Thornton Police Department on August 7, with a simple statement: "126 MPH is definitely dangerous, even for the highway." Further coverage from [KDVR](https://kdvr.com/news/local/thornton-pd-warn-of-court-summons-towing-after-driver-caught-at-126-mph/) noted that the driver was caught on I-25 and that the person was cited for speeding more than 40 miles per hour over the posted limit, as well as for careless driving with a mandatory court appearance. Of the [720 traffic fatalities](https://www.codot.gov/safety/traffic-safety/data-analysis/fatal-crash-data) that took place in Colorado in 2023, [excessive speed was the leading factor](https://www.codot.gov/news/2024/july/speeding-top-cause-fatal-crashes-colorado-2023) in those deaths, involved in 258 fatalities through the end of the year and above both impaired driving fatalities (228) and unrestrained passenger fatalities (222).

author: Jogada10
title: Corinthians ganhará bolada com venda de jovem que nem estreou
text:
O Corinthians receberá aproximadamente R$ 10,8 milhões pela transferência do atacante João Costa da Roma (ITA) para o Al-Ettifaq, da Arábia Saudita. O jogador de 19 anos estava no clube italiano desde 2022 e ainda possuía 20% dos direitos econômicos pertencentes ao Corinthians. Dessa forma, ele foi vendido pelos italianos por cerca de R$ 55 milhões.
João Costa sequer chegou a jogar pelo time profissional do Corinthians e também passou pelas categorias de base do Palmeiras, onde jogou ao lado de Endrick. Na Roma, o atacante participou de partidas na Liga Europa e no Campeonato Italiano.
No balancete financeiro do Corinthians até junho deste ano, foi registrado um déficit de R$ 30,3 milhões. O orçamento para o ano previa um superávit de R$ 15,3 milhões, resultando em um desvio de R$ 45,6 milhões em relação ao previsto.
Esse resultado negativo se deve, em grande parte, às despesas financeiras, incluindo juros e multas contratuais, como as referentes aos técnicos Mano Menezes e António Oliveira, além da ex-patrocinadora Pixbet. O clube estimava um gasto de R$ 43,6 milhões para o semestre, mas os custos reais foram mais do que o dobro, atingindo R$ 96,3 milhões.
Além disso, o Corinthians arrecadou menos com patrocínios do que o esperado, totalizando R$ 105,3 milhões, em comparação com os R$ 125,5 milhões previstos.
Por outro lado, o clube teve um lucro operacional de R$ 65,9 milhões no semestre, R$ 6,9 milhões acima do orçamento. Esse resultado foi impulsionado pela venda do meio-campista Gabriel Moscardo. No total, o Corinthians obteve R$ 118 milhões com transferências de jogadores no semestre.
O departamento financeiro do Corinthians deverá revisar o orçamento de 2024 em breve, e o novo plano precisará ser aprovado pelo Conselho Deliberativo do clube.

author: Evan Jakab
title: The 6 Best Cordless Vacuums For Hardwood Floors - Winter 2024: Reviews
text:
Compared to most other floor types, hardwood is pretty low maintenance in cleaning requirements, with little room for debris to get worked into cracks and crevices. That said, you'll still need to give them a thorough cleaning now and then to ensure that there's no significant buildup of dirt and debris, which can abrade the surface if you leave it to get dragged around. A cordless vacuum is a great way to keep these surfaces clean, especially those with a soft roller brush, which won't leave behind the kind of micro-scratches that can accumulate over time when using a floorhead with stiff bristles.
We've tested over 135 vacuum cleaners, and below are our recommendations for the best cordless vacuum cleaners for hardwood floors. These picks are selected not only based on their performance on bare floors but also their feature set, design, and price. For more options, look at our lists of the best cordless vacuums and the best vacuums for hardwood floors . If you prefer a more hands-off approach to cleaning, check out our recommendations for the best robot vacuums for hardwood floors .
The best cordless vacuum for hardwood floors we've tested is the Dyson V15 Detect. This vacuum comes with two floorheads, one with a multi-surface bristled roller and the other with a soft nylon roller to avoid creating micro-scratches on delicate surfaces like hardwood. Its headlining feature is its automatic power adjustment feature; the V15 will automatically increase its suction power setting when passing onto a carpeted surface. It's great if you have any area rugs on your hardwood floors. The vacuum can run for more than an hour on a charge, which is good for a cordless vacuum, though its runtime does drop dramatically if you run it continuously in its high-power 'Boost' mode.
Thanks to its powerful motor, it does a fantastic job of handling pet hair and solid debris on hard floors. Maneuverability is good, although its strong suction force can cause it to get caught on rug tassels or other loose obstructions. If you're looking for something more portable, the Dyson V12 Detect Slim is another good option with a similar range of features but in a smaller, lighter package. However, note that the V12 has a less powerful motor than the V15 and a smaller dustbin that you'll need to empty pretty often.
Check out the Shark Stratos Cordless if you want something more affordable than the Dyson V15 Detect . It's less powerful than the Dyson and weighs noticeably more. That said, it's as effective at sucking up debris on hard floors and provides many convenience features. Chief among them is its Clean Sense IQ system, which works slightly differently from the Dyson vacuum's surface-sensitive system. Instead of responding to changes in surface type, the Shark automatically adjusts its suction power in real time depending on how much debris you suck up. Its odor-neutralization feature uses a replaceable cartridge that emits a pleasant detergent-like scent as you clean. However, this scent can become somewhat overwhelming if you leave the cartridge at its maximum intensity and clean your home multiple times per week.
While it weighs more than the Dyson and has a bulkier twin-roller floorhead, its flexible wand makes it easy to clean under the furniture. Build quality is also quite good, and the vacuum isn't especially difficult to clean. The sole exception to the latter is its non-removable primary brushroll, which, despite being advertised as self-cleaning, can still get tangled with pet hair. Check out the Miele Triflex HX1 if you're looking for a sturdily-built cordless vacuum with a strong performance on bare floors and a removable brushroll, but note that the Miele has a smaller dustbin and a much shorter battery life.
The best mid-range cordless vacuum for hardwood floors we've tested is the Shark Cordless Pro. This mid-range vacuum shares a lot with the pricier Shark Stratos Cordless , as it has the same odor-neutralizing cartridge and Clean Sense IQ system that allows it to increase its suction power when passing over an area with a lot of debris. However, there are a few concessions to justify its lower purchase price. These include a smaller-capacity battery that can only run the vacuum for about 40 minutes. It also uses a single roller floorhead and a less powerful suction motor.
Thankfully, neither of the last two cost-cutting measures seriously impacts performance, as it delivers superb debris pickup on hard surfaces like hardwood. Its primary brushroll has a fluffy texture to avoid creating micro-scratches on hard floors. Unlike the Stratos and almost every other Shark vacuum, this brushroll can be easily removed from its floorhead, so you can quickly cut away any tangled hair or stuck-on debris.
If you're on a budget and can do without convenience features like automatic power adjustment, the best cordless vacuum for hardwood floors we've tested is the Wyze Cordless Vacuum . This highly affordable stick vacuum feels less sturdily built than the pricier Shark Cordless Pro, and it doesn't have any features like an automatic power adjustment system or an odor-masking cartridge. That said, it still does a good job of handling most kinds of household debris on bare surfaces like hardwood floors, though it's worth noting that really large debris can get stuck at the entry to its dustbin. Unusually for a vacuum in this price range, it has an on-board HEPA filter that's fairly effective in trapping fine dust. Its weight of just over five pounds makes it easy to maneuver, even in cramped environments.
Unlike the Shark's fluffy roller, the Wyze uses a more conventional multi-surface brushroll with bristles. Thankfully, they aren't stiff enough to create micro-scratches on wood floors and provide a greater degree of surface agitation on any rugs you might have in your living room.
The Dyson Omni-glide is a solid option for a cordless vacuum that weighs very little and is well-suited to cleaning hardwood floors. At a little over four pounds, this cordless stick weighs even less than other cordless stick vacuums like the Wyze Cordless Vacuum . Combined with its unique twin roller floorhead, which can pivot in almost any direction, it's a breeze to maneuver in tight spaces and features soft rollers that won't create scratches on hardwood floors. However, its highly compact design comes at the cost of a tiny dirt compartment that'll need emptying at the end of every cleaning session and a weak suction motor that struggles with lifting debris from crevices.
Unfortunately, it's also completely useless for cleaning the occasional rug, as its twin nylon rollers provide almost no surface agitation on carpets. It also has a harder time dealing with bulkier debris, which can clog its narrow suction inlet, and has a short battery life of only about half an hour in its default power setting.
Check out the BISSELL CrossWave Cordless Max if you're looking for an all-in-one machine for all kinds of messes on hardwood floors. This vacuum uses an absorbent fluffy roller and a detergent-dispersal function to wet and scrub away dried-on stains. The BISSELL is also fully capable of sucking up liquid spills. It doesn't exert as much raw suction power as a conventional cordless model like the Shark Stratos Cordless . Battery life is unremarkable, with a runtime of about 40 minutes.
Unfortunately, maneuvering in tight spaces can be a hassle due to its heavy weight. It feels decently well-built but does have a few parts that need periodic washing. Thankfully, you can keep track of its maintenance schedule with the vacuum's smartphone companion app.
Samsung Bespoke Jet: The Samsung Bespoke Jet is the brand's flagship cordless stick vacuum. It comes bundled with a combination charging rack/automatic emptying station and a pair of batteries. That said, unlike the Dyson V15 Detect, it has no automatic power adjustment feature. See our review Shark Vertex Pro Powered Lift-Away: The Shark Vertex Pro Powered Lift-Away is a cordless upright vacuum with a greater debris capacity than the Shark Stratos Cordless. However, it has a more limited set of convenience features, with no automatic power adjustment capability or odor-neutralization cartridge. Its upright configuration also makes maneuvering in tight spots more of a hassle. See our review Dyson V8: The Dyson V8 is a mid-range cordless stick vacuum that's easier to maneuver than the Shark Cordless Pro. However, the latter does have a bigger dustbin and an automatic power adjustment system. See our review Samsung Jet 60: The Samsung Jet 60 is a mid-range cordless stick vacuum with a relatively powerful 150AW suction motor. That said, it does a worse job of dealing with large debris compared to the Shark Cordless Pro, as its floorhead can push around debris instead of passing over it and allowing the vacuum to suck it up. author: Sarah Meade The Health Partnership
title: Hispanic Heritage Month: Woman recalls her cultural story with new family of dancers
text:
Erika Torrejon loves Steamboat Springs. She has a wonderful community, a good life and has had a great career in education. But for Torrejon, who was born in Peru and came to the United states as a young adult, there was still something missing.
“We grew up dancing, since preschool,” Torrejon said. “There are so many dances, from the jungle, the mountains, the coast, I don’t know how many. Probably hundreds. I’d been living in Steamboat for nine years — 10 now — and you crave that.”
There was another piece to that craving, she said.
“Now I have daughters, and you can’t stop thinking, ‘How can they have what I had?'” she said. “I always felt there has to be a way to bring more of my culture to my girls.”
Then she realized something.
“I thought, ‘I bet all of these Peruvians are feeling the same,'” Torrejon recalled. “So I reach out to a friend, another Peruvian, and I talk to her and she says, ‘Yes, me too. I want to do it too.'”
And it spread. Suddenly, there was a group of Peruvian dancers.
“We were ready to do this,” she said. “We gather. We talk. What do we want to do?”
The purpose was clear: not to make money, not to make a business, but to get together and create community.
“We crave that,” she said. “Even though we have community within the community, there’s nothing like being around people with that same sense of humor, that same way of talking.”
They picked a dance and the World Dance Collective was born.
“We’re not professional dancers, but we grew up with this,” Torrejon said.
For Torrejon and the Collective, the opportunity to recall this visceral childhood experience, one deeply ingrained in their cultural heritage, awakened something. And not only something Peruvian.
“There are a lot of countries that would like to show their culture,” she said. “We’re inviting all different countries to join us. Right now it’s Peruvian, but I’ve talked to Colombian friends, and even a woman from Bulgaria.”
The dancers have performed at Art in the Park and elsewhere, and there’s more to come. Steamboat Creates is coming up next.
The first dance they’ve worked to prepare for performance is Afro-Peruvian: Festejo. And its own history has a perhaps unintentional echo of what the troupe is doing now.
“It’s a mix of native and African influence,” Torrejon said. “When the Spanish came to Peru, they brought slaves with them. The slaves didn’t have the instruments they were used to from home, so they adjusted, and it’s a mix of African and native Peruvian.”
In other words, it’s the dance and music of a people from one place, who were moved to another, mixing with the culture of a people who were there when they got there.
“This is in us, it’s in our DNA,” Torrejon said. “We’re born and we listen to this, see it everywhere. It brings our culture close to us and it feels like home. It’s such a good feeling. I’m dancing with Peruvians from all over who I didn’t know three months ago. Now we’re family. I love them all, and it’s brought so much joy to my life.”
And her own family is part of that family.
“My daughters are dancing now, too,” Torrejon said. “And my mother, she’s doing it. There’s a part where we’re in a circle in the dance. My mom didn’t dance these dances—she’s seen them, listened to them —but I said do you want to dance? All of a sudden, I see this circle, my mom’s face looking at me, my daughter’s face, and we’re all dancing. And we just created this. It brings me a lot of joy.”
For more information, to join the World Dance Collective or to donate, email Erika at peruvianraices@gmail.com.
Sarah Meade is the collaborative partnerships manager ath the Health Partnership.

author: Nyasa Times Reporter
title: Community of Sant’ Egidio feats hundreds on Christmas Day
text: Community of Sant’ Egidio feats hundreds on Christmas Day Hundreds of children and elderly people from Mgona and Area 25 Townships in Lilongwe partook in a sumptuous Christmas Lunch the Community of Sant’ Egidio had prepared on Christmas Day. The feast took place at St. Francis Parish Hall at Kanengo. Christmas Lunch is an annual event the community organizes to share the love of Jesus Christ by sharing a meal with the poor, children from underprivileged families and the elderly. The responsible of the Community of Sant’ Egidio in Area 25, Eddah Mtalika, said Christmas Lunch, which has been celebrated for over 25 years now, extends the warmth of Christmas to individuals on the margins of society – the homeless, elderly, refugees, and the disabled. Mtalika disclosed that the community recognizes that not everyone has a family to celebrate with during Christmas festivities. She said a team of volunteers contributed to the lunch, with roles ranging from kitchen duties to fostering a familial atmosphere at tables. “We are grateful to all the people, including our sponsors across the borders, who committed their financial support to this lunch. We are particularly thankful to our guests for making it to this event,” she said. The officiating priest, Father Thomas Pouya, commended members of the Community of Sant’ Egidio for their unwavering dedication and commitment to the service of the poor and underprivileged people. Pouya invoked the spirit of God to always guide the activities and programmes of the community so that more people can benefit in years to come. This year’s Christmas lunch featured a menu of rice with chicken, cabbages and cold drinks. Each guest also received a Christmas present to foster a sense of joy and inclusion.Follow and Subscribe Nyasa TV :
